name: N-methyl-2-[2-(2-methylphenyl)-2-oxoethyl]-N-phenylbenzamide
source: Karthikeyan M.; Glen R.C.; Bender A. General melting point prediction based on a diverse compound dataset and artificial neural networks. J. Chem. Inf. Model.; 2005; 45(3); 581-2481
Reason: 2-[2-(2-methylphenyl)-2-oxoethyl]-N-phenylbenzamide has a melting point that can be predicted by considering its structural components. Starting with the base unit of benzene, which has a melting point of 5.5 °C, we have several functional groups to consider: (1) The methyl group adds approximately +10 °C due to increased molecular weight and rigidity. (2) The phenyl group contributes around +30 °C due to increased molecular weight and pi-stacking interactions. (3) The 2-oxoethyl group introduces a rigid structure and potential hydrogen bonding, estimated at around +10 °C. (4) The methylene bridge can add approximately +5 °C due to increased molecular weight and rigidity.
